thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Oil Prices Continue to Rise Fueled by Iran Deal Concerns

author: Biman Mukherji
title: Oil Prices Continue to Rise Fueled by Iran Deal Concerns
text:
U.S. oil prices broke through the $70 mark for the first time since 2014, reflecting both increased geopolitical risks and a healthier backdrop as the industry works off what had been a persistent supply glut.
Oil prices have risen more than 10% in the past month as President Donald Trump has indicated it is likely the U.S. will withdraw from a 2015 international agreement with Iran that eased sanctions in return for curbs to its nuclear program.
... RELATED VIDEO What Is the 2015 Iran Nuclear Deal? Iran reached a historic agreement with major world powers over its nuclear program in 2015. Under the deal, what did Iran give up and how is it benefiting? WSJâ€™s Niki Blasina explains.
